Package tk.halfgray.pcommandbot

PCommandBot is a bot that responds to commands sent through IRC.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Responder
    Utility for responding to a command, depending on the nature of the message that invoked it.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CoreCommandResponder
    Utility to respond to the core command.
    FixedResponder
    Responder that responds with a fixed message.
    Main
    Simple main class for text commands.
    PCommandBot
    Bot that responds to commands sent through IRC.
    Utilities
    General utilities

Package tk.halfgray.pcommandbot Description

PCommandBot is a bot that responds to commands sent through IRC.

A command consists of a command prefix, a command string, whitespace, and an argument. Command prefixes are case-sensitive, but command strings are not. The argument is read until the end of the message, or until the (case-sensitive) argument terminator is reached (if the bot is configured with one). The argument is always "supertrimmed" with supertrim(String) before processing. Any text before the command prefix is ignored for processing (except for mentions).

Commands may be sent publicly or privately. For public commands, any users whose names are included anywhere in the message are considered "mentioned," and any response to the command mentions them as well.

An application should create a new instance of PCommandBot and configure it.
